result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry R Royce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If probtion is revoked, court grants sentence credit in an amount to be calculated by the Door County Jail.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed.   Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: Letters from DCC Records staff to Court regarding sentence structure.              Amend JOC to 2 years probation on Counts 1 & 3. DTE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jerry R Royce in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Jerry R Royce in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1, 2 & 3. Court dismisses Cts. 4 & 5 and 14-TR-1193 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Atty Korb/Atty Schaefer make sentencing statements. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Jerry R Royce in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Jerry R Royce in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jerry R Royce in court with attorney Linda J Schaefer.  Defendant Jerry R Royce in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, hopes to get a pretrial offer from the State within the next few days to resolve both matters. Atty Schaefer waives time limit for prelim, requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/07/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 7/31/14)
Initial appearance on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with J. L., A.G. & A.B.  Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.   To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Jerry R Royce appears by video conference along with attorney Eric S Maciolek, who appears by phone.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
